conclusion: Determine the length of the arc where incident light cannot directly exit through AB or BC.
ABC is an arc centered at O with radius R; ABCO forms a square, so OA = OB = OC = R.
The refractive index n of the material is 2.
The critical angle for total internal reflection is calculated as θ_c = 30°.
At point E, the light undergoes total internal reflection with an angle of incidence θ_i = 30°; at point H, the light incident on BC is at the critical angle, so ∠HOC = 30°.
The angle subtended by the arc EH where light cannot exit is calculated as ∠EOH = 30°.
The circumference of the full circle is 2πR.
The arc length EH is calculated as πR/6.
Considering light from both sides, the total arc length is πR/3.
The length of the arc where the light cannot directly exit through AB or BC is πR/3.
